poem:
"In Quest of Questions Unanswered"

Beneath the paper's black and white,
Mystery in square miles, sugar not from plants,
Notes of a black woman's song flutter.
Legal battles fought over unwritten scopes,
In the cosmic ballet spins a lonely dwarf.
Evasions of a president abound,
And yet, in asking, we find no answers -
In the inquiry, the art unfurls.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What links Ana Matronic and the Guardian? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 At about 1,500 square miles, A23a is the world’s largest what?2 Which sugar doesn’t come from plants?3 Who, in 1954, was the first black woman to have a UK No 1 single?4 What was the subject of the legal case Tennessee v Scopes?5 What is the only dwarf planet within Neptune’s orbit?6 Which US president vowed, “I’m not going to eat any". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
